top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.

I just want to apologize to whoever owns the email SmellyFarts@gmail.com.


I use this email every time I need to create an account to view a website.
Yeah, that's totally a hard pass for me. I don't care what the product or service is.

But if a website has clear explanation of the product, with screenshot and video, but requires an account to use it because you're saving your data, is that also a bad move?

How can I let people create their stuff and let them come back to this stuff afterwards?

top_comments_best.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

I just want to apologize to whoever owns the email SmellyFarts@gmail.com.


I use this email every time I need to create an account to view a website.
Yeah, that's totally a hard pass for me. I don't care what the product or service is.
Seems like I can barely view anything on Facebook or instagram these days without logging in. I do tend to regret going on there so that tracks.
